business.headline: Vijay Shekhar Sharma's resilient leadership helps Paytm stay profitable for the second quarter in a rowThe performance underscores his disciplined cost approach, focus on fundamentals-led growth and early push to embed AI across the business, which are now delivering tangible results.
Sensex, Nifty end flat as profit booking offsets positive triggersThe S&P BSE Sensex was up just 12.16 points to close at 84,478.67, while the NSE Nifty50 ended at 25,879.15, just 3 points up.

Want to be a crorepati? Here's how SIPs can help you reach Rs 1 croreSIPs allow people to invest small amounts regularly, and over time, these small steps can grow into meaningful wealth. Although Rs 1 crore sounds like a big number, it's achievable and can be built one SIP at a time.

You quit smoking and drinking. So why is your health insurance still costly?Even after quitting, insurers continue to charge higher premiums, and former smokers or drinkers are still treated as high-risk for years.

boAt founders step down before IPO: Should investors be concerned?Having been the face of their brands for years, these founders suddenly moving to non-executive positions has raised questions about intent and timing.

Fujiyama Power IPO opens for subscription: Check key details, latest GMPFujiyama Power has set its price band at Rs 216 to Rs 228 per share, with a lot size of 65 shares. At the upper end of the band, the IPO size stands at Rs 828 crore, comprising a fresh issue of Rs 600 crore (2.63 crore shares) and an OFS of Rs 228 crore (1 crore shares).

Ashok Leyland shares jump after Q2 results. Should you buy, hold or sell?Ashok Leyland's Q2 numbers lifted the stock, with analysts divided between strong margin-led optimism and concerns over the MHCV cycle's volatility. With targets ranging widely, is the next leg of growth convincing enough?

Honasa Consumer shares jump up to 9% after strong Q2 earnings: Should you buy?Honasa Consumer's strong Q2 turnaround, rising margins and category momentum have lifted the stock sharply, but stretched valuations and divided analyst views now raise the question: is the rally sustainable?

PhysicsWallah IPO struggles to find takers: Should you subscribe?Despite strong brand recognition and support from anchor investors, the IPO has so far been subscribed only 14%, reflecting weak investor interest.

Sensex, Nifty open slightly lower despite global optimism, record-low inflationAt around 9:21 am, the Sensex slipped 143 points to 84,323, while the Nifty50 fell 60 points to 25,816. Broader markets were also under pressure, indicating some profit booking after recent gains.

Gold, silver rate today: How will US shutdown end impact precious metals?After weeks of uncertainty, both houses of the US Congress have passed a deal to reopen the government, ending the longest shutdown in US history.

US government shutdown to end: Will it result in a rally for Sensex, Nifty?Stock market today: Gift Nifty futures were trading at 25,950.5 points at 8:00 am, suggesting that the Nifty50 will open above Wednesday's closing level of 25,875.80.

Applying for a personal loan? Don't fall for these 5 common scam tacticsThe race to get fast loans has made many borrowers easy targets for fraudsters. Scammers use fake apps, urgent messages and sweet deals to trap people. Spotting the red flags can save you from serious financial trouble.

Gold prices continue to rise. Why are they climbing?After months of ups and downs, gold is once again on the rise. With fresh global triggers and growing demand, the metal is gaining strength. Here's a closer look at the factors fuelling the latest surge.

Retail inflation eases to record low of 0.25% in October as food prices fallThe latest consumer price index (CPI) print was well below expectations and marks the lowest reading since the current CPI series began in 2015, which uses 2012 as the base year.

Is your income tax refund delayed? Here's how interest is calculated on itWaiting endlessly for your tax refund can test anyone's patience. The silver lining? The government compensates you with interest for delays — at a fixed rate, calculated monthly. But there are rules, limits and exceptions. Let's decode them.
Sensex, Nifty end higher as US optimism sparks IT rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 595.19 points to close at 84,466.51, while the NSE Nifty50 added 180.85 points to end at 25,875.80.

Gold without the glitter: Why investors are moving away from physical goldIn October 2025, India recorded the third-highest gold ETF inflows globally, behind only the United States and China, a clear sign that the country's love for gold is being redefined in the digital era.

Buying a house just because you can afford the EMI? Think againThe calculator may say you can afford it, but life may say otherwise. A home loan is not just a financial decision — it impacts savings, career choices, and long-term stability.

Explained: Why Adani Enterprises shares have gained over 6% todayAdani Enterprises share price: The rise came after the company announced plans for a Rs 24,930-crore rights issue, its biggest fundraising move since the cancelled follow-on public offering (FPO) in 2023.

entertainment.headline: Ranbir Kapoor's finsta confession: No Alia Bhatt, only reel with Raha Ranbir Kapoor recently revealed details about his private Instagram presence. He also explained his reasons for keeping his wife, Alia Bhatt, from following him.

Dulquer Salmaan shares Mammootty's take on acting: Only great actors can overact Dulquer Salmaan recently shared his father's perspective on acting and addressed compliments about his own skills during an interview about his upcoming film 'Kaantha'.

Mridul Tiwari's surprise eviction from Bigg Boss 19 sparks social media outcry Mridul Tiwari's sudden exit from Bigg Boss 19 during a surprise mid-week eviction has left viewers expressing disbelief and disappointment. Many social media users have questioned the move and questioned the fairness of the show's format.

Shehbaz's big Bigg Boss confusion: To use Shehnaaz's name or cry about it later? Shehbaz Badesha's journey in 'Bigg Boss 19' is turning into a masterclass in confusion. He keeps invoking sister Shehnaaz Gill's name for applause, only to later play the victim.

Gulshan Devaiah on Tamil debut with Madhavan's Legacy: Time to spread my wings Gulshan Devaiah, who is set to make his Tamil debut in the upcoming crime drama series 'Legacy', shares his thoughts on diversifying his filmography with a Tamil debut following his foray into Kannada cinema.

I knew Thamma worked when children started talking about it: Aaditya Sarpotdar Filmmaker Aaditya Sarpotdar reflected on the success of 'Thamma' and his journey within Maddock Films' growing horror-comedy universe, sharing insights on world-building, working with stars like Ayushmann Khurrana and Rashmika Mandanna, and what lies ahead for the franchise.

Kichcha Sudeep wraps Mark, promises Christmas release as planned Kichcha Sudeep has completed shooting for his upcoming Kannada film 'Mark'. The film is set for a festive release on December 25, promising a thrilling box office clash with Arjun Janya's '45'.

Netflix this week: Delhi Crime Season 3, Jolly LLB 3, and more Netflix's new week of releases brings a thrilling mix of crime, romance, fantasy, and holiday drama, led by 'Delhi Crime' Season 3 and 'Jolly LLB 3'. With 'Dynamite Kiss' and 'A Quiet Place: Day One' adding to the variety, viewers are in for a binge-worthy lineup.

Comic Ashish Chanchlani to host Globetrotter event, makers drop fun video A quirky reveal video featuring Ashish Chanchlani and SS Rajamouli has taken social media by storm, as the makers officially announced the YouTuber as the host of the upcoming 'Globetrotter' event.

Dulquer Salmaan admits criticism affects him: Some people say I can't act Ahead of the release of 'Kaantha', Dulquer Salmaan reflects on a recurring criticism that he can't act and how it pushes him to constantly raise the bar.

Prime Video, ZEE5: Top OTT releases to watch this week Prime Video and ZEE5 bring a power-packed slate of new releases this week, featuring Anurag Kashyap's 'Nishaanchi', the revenge thriller 'Malice', and the eerie comedy 'Inspection Bunglow'. Marathi thriller 'Dashavatar' rounds off the list with mystery and intrigue.

Rashmika Mandanna fights back tears as she gets emotional at The Girlfriend event A video of Rashmika Mandanna growing emotional during 'The Girlfriend' success event has gone viral, prompting reactions from fans and spotlighting the film's box-office achievement. 'The Girlfriend' is receiving rave reviews from critics and audiences alike.

Director Sundar C exits Rajinikanth's Thalaivar 173, produced by Kamal Haasan Director Sundar C has announced his exit from the upcoming project 'Thalaivar 173', which features Rajinikanth and is produced by Kamal Haasan. The director cited unforeseen and unavoidable circumstances as the reason for his decision to withdraw from the highly anticipated collaboration.

Hyun Bin's Made in Korea renewed for Season 2 ahead of December premiere Disney+ has confirmed a second season for its Korean crime drama 'Made in Korea' ahead of the show's first season premiere in December. Production has already started on the follow-up, and the new season is expected to arrive in late 2026.

Now You See Me Now You Don't review: Magic fades too soon to sustain the illusionRelease Date:Thu Nov 13, 2025 Now You See Me: Now You Don't movie review: The Horsemen return with new magicians in a globe-trotting diamond heist. The film offers flashy magic and nostalgia but struggles with a complex plot and coherence, says our review.

Not a public event: Rajamouli issues strict guidelines for Globetrotter gala Ace director SS Rajamouli urged fans to strictly follow the police-issued security guidelines for the upcoming 'Globetrotter' event on November 15. The grand gala will take place at Ramoji Film City in Hyderabad.

Are You Sure season 2: BTS' Jimin and Jungkook return this December on OTT The second season of BTS members Jimin and Jungkook's travel reality show, 'Are You Sure?', will begin streaming on JioHotstar from December. The eight-episode series, marks the pair's first joint project since finishing military service.

Delhi Crime 3 review: Shefali-Huma's show is gripping, gutting but lacks thrillRelease Date:Thu Nov 13, 2025 Delhi Crime Season 3 series review: 'Delhi Crime 3', delves into human trafficking with a gripping narrative.  The show, led by Shefali Shah's powerful performance, highlights social apathy and gender biases.

Vijay's Thalapathy Kacheri gets 44 million views due to bots? YouTube responds Allegations surfaced on social media regarding inflated view counts for the lyric video of 'Thalapathy Kacheri' from 'Jana Nayagan'. YouTube clarified its verification process and responded to concerns about bot-driven views.

general news.headline: Trouble for terror-tainted Al-Falah: Site taken down, accreditation notice, ED heat Live UpdatesDelhi blast: Ever since it has been thrust into the spotlight following the Red Fort blast, there has been no end to trouble for Haryana's Al-Falah University. Now, its funding as well as accreditation are under scanner.

Bihar will see Nepal-like protests if polls are tampered with: RJD leader sparks rowThe RJD leader said that he had asked all officials involved in counting not to tamper with the public mandate, warning that if they did so, Bihar could witness unrest similar to what was seen in Nepal, Bangladesh, and Sri Lanka.

Don't stereotype Kashmiris as terrorists, only few spoiling peace: Omar AbdullahOmar Abdullah urged people not to stereotype all Kashmiris as terrorists, saying such generalisations harm efforts to keep communities on the right path. He stressed that only a few individuals are responsible for disrupting peace.

Sena leader dupes pani puri seller of Rs 3 lakh by 'selling' Mumbai footpathA pani puri seller has accused a Mulund-based Shiv Sena leader of fraudulently 'selling' a chunk of footpath to him for Rs 3 lakh in 2023. Two years have now passed, but the pani puri seller has neither been handed over the space nor the money.

Explained: Supreme Court's tough questions to petitioners against SIR in Tamil Nadu, BengalThe recently-concluded Assembly polls in Bihar could have ramifications that may resonate well beyond the political arena. The first signs emerged on Tuesday during the Supreme Court's hearing of petitions against the SIR exercise in Tamil Nadu and West Bengal.

Delhi pollution very serious, even masks not enough: Supreme CourtDelhi woke up to a thick blanket of smog on Thursday morning, as the city's air quality remained in the 'severe' category for the third straight day.

Building 17, room 13: Al-Falah University hostel where doctors plotted terrorDelhi blast: Investigations have revealed that room number 13 in building 17 inside the sprawling Al-Falah University campus served as the secret meeting point for the terror module.

Jemimah Rodrigues opens up on family trolling, tough road to World Cup winJemimah Rodrigues reflected on a painful phase when her family faced false allegations soon after India's early T20 World Cup exit. A year later, she played a pivotal role in India's Women's World Cup win.

Satyam, wake up: Man found inside car boot during surprise police check in DelhiA video going viral on social media shows the police discovering a man sleeping inside the car's trunk after the driver opened it for a security check.

CCTV: Bengaluru techie rams car into motorist after being honked at signal, arrestedPolice arrested a software engineer for allegedly ramming a motorist's car in a deliberate road-rage attack on October 26 in Bengaluru. CCTV footage showed it was intentional, not an accident. The case was upgraded to attempt to murder.

Longest US shutdown ends, but the massive damage is here to stay | 5 pointsThe longest shutdown in US history may have officially ended, but its aftershocks will linger. From grounded planes and frozen paychecks to missing economic data and shattered trust in federal aid, America's systems are crippled because of the lapse in appropriation. With another shutdown looming on January 30, the relief from Trump's reopening could be short-lived.

Out on bail in school jobs scam, ex-Bengal minister names co-accused as girlfriendBack in 2021, the Mamata Banerjee government was left red-faced when the Enforcement Directorate recovered Rs 50 crore from Arpita Mukherjee's flats, leading to the arrest of both Arpita and Partha in connection with the scam. What also set rumour mills spinning was the discovery of sex toys.

Ananya Panday says Gen Z is emotionally liberated. But is that really true?Gen Z loves to talk about their emotions, but sometimes maybe a little too much. Does this emotional openness make them a bit too sensitive?

Kerala shuts newly opened zoo after 10 deer die in stray dog attack, probe onTen deer died at the newly inaugurated Puthur Zoological Park after panicking during a stray dog attack. Experts said the deaths were caused by capture myopathy. A three-member panel will submit a preliminary report in four days.

CIA dropped modified poppy seeds to weaken Afghan heroin trade: ReportThe Washington Post revealed the CIA secretly dropped modified poppy seeds over Afghanistan for a decade to weaken its opium trade, a covert operation that proved costly and largely ineffective.
India ranks second for office romances in new surveyAccording to a new survey by dating platform Ashley Madison, India ranks second when it comes to people workplace affairs.

Video: Car used in Delhi blast crossed Haryana toll plaza with explosives uncheckedIn a shocking revelation, the white Hyundai i20 car that was blown up by terrorist Dr Umar Un Nabi near Red Fort in Delhi on November 10, was seen crossing a toll plaza in Haryana and it went unchecked.

Live: Terror module suspect visited J&K before Red Fort explosionDelhi Red Fort Blast Live Updates: A powerful explosion ripped through a Hyundai i20 near Delhi's Red Fort Metro Station at around 6.50 pm on Monday, killing 13 people and injuring 20 others. The explosion took place in a slow-moving car that had stopped at a red light just outside the Red Fort metro station. The Union Cabinet on Wednesday officially classified the blast as a "terrorist act" carried out by "anti-national elements." Stay tuned to indiatoday.in for all the latest updates.
Field Marshal Munir's Musharraf planIs Pakistan's new dictator Asim Munir embracing a former dictator Pervez Musharraf's strategy of death by a thousand cuts?

2 killed, 5 injured in massive explosion at firecracker factory in UP's BarabankiThe survivors were initially taken to a nearby hospital but were later referred to the Trauma Centre in Lucknow as their condition worsened.

When South Korea shuts down for Suneung, the 9-hour exam that decides futuresEvery November, South Korea stops for the Suneung, a 9-hour national exam that can make or break a student's future. Offices open late, planes stop flying, and millions hold their breath as 18-year-olds face one of the toughest academic tests in the world.

Indian truckers caught in wrong lane, California cancels 17,000 licencesThe US state of California is set to revoke 17,000 commercial drivers' licences issued to foreigners after the Donald Trump administration flagged concerns over illegal immigration. Indian-origin truck drivers, who once filled the employment gap amid dwindling American manpower, are likely to be affected. The move follows deadly road crashes involving illegal truckers, some of whom were Indians.

UP doctor shares video of woman mocking daughter-in-law in labour, sparks outrageThe video shows the young woman lying on the hospital bed, surrounded by her family members. Her husband is seen holding her hand while other relatives laugh at the elderly woman's remarks.

Socialist victories in capitalist US: After NYC, Seattle gets Mamdani-like mayorAfter Zohran Mamdani's win in New York City, another "socialist", Katie Wilson, won mayoral polls in Seattle on the West Coast. William's narrow victory in Seattle is another socialist breakthrough in a major US city. William's campaign mirrored that of Mamdani's, where she focussed on affordable housing, public transit, and stronger renter protections.

sports.headline: IPL 2026 retention prediction: Can Gujarat Titans solve their middle-order muddle? IPL 2026: Gujarat Titans boast a strong top order and an effective bowling attack, but their middle order remains a concern, an area they must strengthen to become a more formidable side in next year's tournament.

Lakshya storms into Kumamoto Masters QF, HS Prannoy knocked out Lakshya Sen stormed into the Kumamoto Masters quarterfinals with one of his most dominant wins of the season, keeping India's hopes alive in the men's singles draw. HS Prannoy, however, bowed out after a straight-game loss to Rasmus Gemke.

Rohit, Kohli need rhythm and runs in every series before 2027 World Cup: Pujara Cheteshwar Pujara believes Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma must regain rhythm consistently as they approach the 2027 ODI World Cup. With both playing only one format, every series now becomes crucial to staying sharp and in form.

Shardul Thakur traded to Mumbai Indians for Rs 2 Crore from Lucknow Super Giants Shardul Thakur has been traded to Mumbai Indians (MI) from Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) for Rs 2 Crore ahead of the Indian Premier League 2026 (IPL 2026). Thakur played ten matches for LSG in IPL 2025 and scalped 13 wickets

Jemimah Rodrigues mesmerises fans, sings Ye Dosti after Women's World Cup win In an interview with India Today, Indian cricketer Jemimah Rodrigues delighted fans by singing the iconic song Yeh Dosti from the classic film Sholay. The performance came shortly after she played a key role in India's Women's World Cup triumph.

England should revive sandpaper gate trauma to derail Steve Smith, says Panesar Monty Panesar has urged England to revive the Sandpapergate controversy and target Steve Smith mentally ahead of the Ashes opener, calling sledging a "strategic masterstroke." Smith, however, has a history of thriving under pressure.

World Cup win second turning point for Indian women's cricket: Jemimah Rodrigues In an interview with India Today, Jemimah Rodrigues said India's Women's World Cup triumph marked the second major turning point for women's cricket in the country, the first being their runners-up finish at the 2017 World Cup in England and Wales.

Rishabh Pant on recovery from toe fracture: Never easy to come back after injury Rishabh Pant reflects on his challenging road to recovery from a toe fracture, sharing insights on his mental resilience and gratitude as he prepares to return to Test cricket after four months. IPL 2026: Shane Watson joins Kolkata Knight Riders as assistant coachKolkata Knight Riders have appointed Australian legend Shane Watson as their new assistant coach ahead of IPL 2026. Watson brings vast T20 experience and joins Abhishek Nayar's coaching setup as KKR aims to return to title-winning form.

Shubman Gill on workload challenge: Still figuring out how to manage three formatsIndia captain Shubman Gill said he is still learning how to manage the demands of being an all-format cricketer, especially with leadership responsibilities across multiple teams.

Tough test against WTC champions, crucial series in WTC final race: Shubman GillIndia captain Shubman Gill acknowledged that defending WTC champions South Africa would pose a major challenge in the upcoming two-match Test series. "We know that it won't be easy against reigning WTC champions. There will be tough moments. But we have handled them well. These two Tests are important in the race to the WTC final," Shubman Gill noted.

Ajith Kumar's new helmet design unites his faith, life story and racing spiritA racer at heart and a star by destiny, Ajith Kumar has transformed his helmet into a vivid canvas of faith, philosophy and identity. As the founder of Ajith Kumar Racing gears up for the upcoming season, here are the exclusive details behind his striking new helmet design.

PM Modi asked us to visit schools, inspire students: World champion HarmanpreetIndian women's team captain Harmanpreet Kaur was felicitated in Chennai on Thursday for leading India to its maiden ICC Women's Cricket World Cup title earlier this month. During the event, Kaur revealed that Prime Minister Narendra Modi had sent a message congratulating the team and encouraging them to continue inspiring the nation.

Sai Sudharsan has potential but needs to start converting his starts vs SA: PujaraFormer India batter Cheteshwar Pujara feels the upcoming Test series against South Africa will be key for Sai Sudharsan, who has impressed with his potential but is still searching for big scores despite several promising starts.

Pakistan move tri-series to Rawalpindi after Sri Lanka players flag safety concernsPakistan has shifted its upcoming T20 tri-series to Rawalpindi due to rising security concerns in the wake of a suicide attack in Islamabad.

Japan Masters: Lakshya Sen enters quarterfinal after beating Jia Heng Jason TehLakshya Sen advanced to the quarterfinals of the Kumamoto Masters Japan with a straight-games win over Singapore's Jia Heng Jason Teh on Thursday.

Euro 2028 to kick off in Cardiff, Wembley to host finalCardiff will host the opening match of the 2028 European Championship on June 9, while the final has been scheduled for London's Wembley Stadium on July 9, tournament organiser UEFA announced on Wednesday.

NZ vs WI: New Zealand cruise past West Indies after Duffy sparks top-order collapseJacob Duffy's four-wicket burst and a commanding opening stand from Tim Robinson and Devon Conway powered New Zealand to an eight-wicket win over the West Indies. The visitors crumbled early and never recovered as the hosts wrapped up the chase with ease.

No past scars, no fear: Hashim Amla on why South Africa's rookies may thrive in IndiaHashim Amla believes South Africa's inexperience in Indian conditions could be a hidden strength, freeing the Proteas from past baggage. With only five players from the 2019 tour returning, he feels a fresh mindset may help them rewrite their story in India.

Australia's Steve Smith questions England's all-out pace plans for AshesSteve Smith believes England may have picked the wrong bowlers for the Ashes, arguing that Australian wickets are likely to reward seam and swing more than an all-out pace attack.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
